Max.Label: Maximum Ability Score
Max.Hint: Ability score cannot be increased above this value using ability score increases.

All.Label: All Skills
All.Hint: These other abilities will be provided as alternate choices for any skill that uses this ability as its default. The highest of the available ability mods will be used.

Proficient.Label: Proficient skills
Proficient.Hint: These other abilities will be provided as alternate choices only for proficient skills that uses this ability as its default. The highest of the available ability mods will be used.

Check.Label: Ability Check Bonus
Check.GlobalHint: Bonus formula applied to all ability checks.
Check.SpecificHint: Bonus formula applied to all checks made with this ability.

DC.Label: DC Bonus
DC.GlobalHint: Bonus formula applied to the DCs of all abilities.
DC.SpecificHint: Bonus formula applied to the DC created for each ability.

Save.Label: Saving Throw Bonus
Save.GlobalHint: Bonus formula applied to all saving throws made with this ability.
Save.SpecificHint: Bonus formula applied to all saving throws.

Configuration.Hint: Bonuses apply to save or check formulas and minimums prevent the d20 roll from dropping below a certain number.

Global.Label: Global Ability Configuration
Global.Hint: The following options apply to all abilities.

Check.Label: Ability Check Minimum
Check.GlobalHint: When rolling any ability check, the result will never be lower than this value.
Check.SpecificHint: When rolling any check with this ability, the result will never be lower than this value.

CheckProficiency.Label: Ability Check Proficiency Floor
CheckProficiency.Hint: Minimum proficiency multiplier for all ability checks.

Save.Label: Saving Throw Minimum
Save.GlobalHint: When rolling any saving throw, the result will never be lower than this value.
Save.SpecificHint: When rolling any saving throw with this ability, the result will never be lower than this value.

SaveProficiency.Label: Saving Throw Proficiency Floor
SaveProficiency.Hint: Minimum proficiency multiplier for all saving throws.

EH.Action.Override.Critical.Multiplier.Hint: Amount by which the damage dice are multiplied on critical hits.
EH.Activation.Label: Activation
EH.Activation.Amount.Label: Activation Amount
EH.Activation.Amount.Hint: Number of action points required when using cinematic actions.
EH.Activation.Amount.ActionPoints.Label: Action Points
EH.Activation.Condition.Label: Activation Condition
EH.Activation.Condition.Hint: Under what conditions can this item be activated?
EH.Activation.Cost.Label: Activation Cost
EH.Activation.Cost.Hint: What is the cost of activating this item under the action economy.
EH.Actor.Category.People.Label: People
EH.Actor.Category.Places.Label: Places
EH.Actor.Category.Things.Label: Things

Message.Delete: Deleting this item will also delete all advancement choices made for it. These changes will be removed from your Hero as long as the checkbox below is checked.
Message.LevelDown: Leveling this Hero down will also undo all advancement choices made for it. These changes will be removed from your Hero as long as the checkbox below is checked.

Config.Title: Configure {item} Advancement
Config.DropHint: Drop Items here to add them to this advancement.

Warning.Duplicate: That item already exists on this advancement.
Warning.Invalid: {type} items cannot be added with this advancement type.
Warning.Recursive: You cannot grant an item in its own advancement.

Close.Title: Stop Advancement
Close.Message: If the advancement process is cancelled, choices made so far will be discarded and no changes will be made to the hero.

Restart.Title: Restart Advancement Choices
Restart.Message: Are you sure you wish to undo all choices so far?

Migration.Title: Migrate Advancement
Migration.Hint: Select which of the following advancements will be added to {name}.

AbilityScores.Title: Ability Score Assignment
AbilityScores.Hint: Provide player options for assigning initial ability scores.

PointBuy.Label: Point Buy
PointBuy.Hint: Spend a number of points to set starting abilities.

Rolling.Label: Rolling
Rolling.Hint: Roll scores and assign results to specific abilities.

StartingArray.Label: Starting Array
StartingArray.Hint: Select ability scores from a fixed list.

Error.Duplicates: All assignments must have different values.
Error.NoMethod: Ability Score Assignment method must be selected.
Error.Incomplete: All abilities must have an assigned score.

ASI.Title: Ability Score Increase
ASI.Hint: Allow the player to increase one or more ability scores.

Defense.Title: Defense
Defense.Hint: Set an archetype's defense ability and its bonus at various levels.

Abilities.Label: Defense Abilities
Abilities.Hint: Ability that will be used to calculate defense score. If multiple are selected, the highest will be used.

HitPoints.Title: Hit Points
HitPoints.Hint: Set an archetype's hit die size and track a player's hit points as they gain levels.

Error.Empty: Hit points must be rolled or the fixed value must be taken.
Error.Invalid: Hit points must be a valid whole number.

ItemGrant.Title: Grant Features
ItemGrant.Hint: Grant the character features when they reach a certain level.

Resource.Title: Resource
Resource.Hint: Set up a resource that is displayed on the sheet (such as Influence or Genius).

ScaleValue.Title: Scale Value
ScaleValue.Hint: A single value that changes as a Hero increases in level and is made available in roll formulas.
ScaleValue.IdentifierHint: This scale value for the current level will be available using @scale.{identifier} in a formula.

Dice.Label: Dice
Dice.Hint: Use this for dice values like Influence, Smash Damage, or Weak Spot.

Generic.Label: Generic
Generic.Hint: Use this for scale values that don't fit into any other category.

Number.Label: Numeric
Number.Hint: Use this for purely numerical values like flat damage bonuses.

Trait.Title: Proficiency
Trait.Hint: Grant the player proficiency in saves, skills, or equipment.

Choices.Label: Choices
Choices.Hint: The player will be able to choose from among these {type}, limited by the number of selections allowed. If nothing is checked, they will be able to select from any available.

Expertise.Label: Expertise
Expertise.Hint: Gain expertise in something with which you already have proficiency.

Upgrade.Label: Upgrade
Upgrade.Hint: Gain proficiency unless you already have it, otherwise gain expertise.

EH.Ammunition.Empty.Label: No Ammunition Chosen
EH.Ammunition.Standard.Label: Standard {type} Rounds
EH.Ammunition.Properties.Hint: Properties that will be added or removed from the weapon when this ammunition is equipped. A 1 indicates the property will be added while -1 indicated it will be removed.
EH.Ammunition.Type.Label: Ammunition Type
EH.Ammunition.Type.Cannon.Label: Cannon
EH.Ammunition.Type.MachineGun.Label: Machine Gun
EH.Ammunition.Type.Pistol.Label: Pistol
EH.Ammunition.Type.Rifle.Label: Rifle
EH.Ammunition.Type.Shotgun.Label: Shotgun
EH.Armor.Damage.Label: Damage
EH.Armor.Damage.Hint: Is this armor currently damaged? Damage armor imposes disadvantage on armor saving throws.
EH.Armor.Action.Damage.Label: Damage {type}
EH.Armor.Action.Repair.Label: Repair {type}
EH.Armor.Action.Save.Label: Armor Saving Throw
EH.Armor.Bonuses.Save.Label: Armor Save Bonus
EH.Armor.Bonuses.Save.Hint: Formula for the bonus added to any saving throw made with this armor.
EH.Armor.Property.Label: Armor Properties
EH.Armor.Property.Awkward.Label: Awkward
EH.Armor.Property.Awkward.Hint: Awkward armor and shields slow your movement by 10 feet when worn and impose disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws and Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks. If a character is wearing both, apply the penalties only once.
EH.Armor.Property.Ballistic.Label: Ballistic
EH.Armor.Property.Ballistic.Hint: Ballistic armor defends only against ranged attacks.
EH.Armor.Property.Concealable.Label: Concealable
EH.Armor.Property.Concealable.Hint: Concealable armor gives advantage on ability checks to conceal it.
EH.Armor.Property.Small.Label: Small
EH.Armor.Property.Small.Hint: A small shield provides less protection against ranged attacks, only offering ½ cover instead of the normal ¾ cover.
EH.Armor.Property.StabProof.Label: Stab Proof
EH.Armor.Property.StabProof.Hint: This armor defends only against piercing and slashing damage.
EH.Armor.State.Hint: Damaged armor imposes disadvantage on all armor saving throws made with it.
EH.Armor.Type.Label: Armor Type
EH.Armor.Type.Armor.Label: Armor
EH.Armor.Type.Shield.Label: Shield
EH.Attributes.Label: Attributes
EH.Biography.Label: Biography
EH.Bonus.Global.Attack.Label: Global Attack Bonuses
EH.Bonus.Global.Attack.Hint: Bonuses applied to all attacks based on type. Currently supported keys are 'all', 'melee', and 'ranged'.
EH.Bonus.Global.Damage.Label: Global Damage Bonuses
EH.Bonus.Global.Damage.Hint: Bonuses applied to base weapon damage based on type. Currently supported keys are 'all', 'melee', and 'ranged'.
EH.Bulk.Label: Bulk
EH.Bulk.Bonus.Label: Bulk Bonus
EH.Bulk.Max.Label: Max Bulk
EH.ChallengeRating.Label: Challenge Rating
EH.CinematicAction.Max.Label: Action Points
EH.CinematicAction.Max.Hint: Total of number of cinamatic action points available per round.
EH.CinematicAction.Spent.Label: Spent Action Points
EH.CinematicAction.Warning.NotFound: Actor doesn't have cinematic actions to consume.
EH.Condition.Level.Effect.Label: Associated Effect
EH.Condition.Level.Effect.Hint: Active Effect that will be added automatically at this level.
EH.Condition.Target.Label: Applicable To
EH.Condition.Type.Label: Type
EH.Condition.Type.Hint: Method by which the different levels of this condition are applied.
EH.Condition.Blinded.Label: Blinded
EH.Condition.BlownTires.Label: Blown Tires
EH.Condition.BodyDamage.Label: Body Damage
EH.Condition.Burning.Label: Burning
EH.Condition.Deafened.Label: Deafened
EH.Condition.Distracted.Label: Distracted
EH.Condition.Encumbered.Label: Encumbered
EH.Condition.Exhausted.Label: Exhausted
EH.Condition.Frightened.Label: Frightened
EH.Condition.Grappled.Label: Grappled
EH.Condition.Incapacitated.Label: Incapacitated
EH.Condition.Intoxicated.Label: Intoxicated
EH.Condition.LossOfControl.Label: Loss of Control
EH.Condition.LossOfPower.Label: Loss of Power
EH.Condition.Paralyzed.Label: Paralyzed
EH.Condition.Prone.Label: Prone
EH.Condition.Restrained.Label: Restrained
EH.Condition.Sickened.Label: Sickened
EH.Condition.Stunned.Label: Stunned
EH.Condition.Totaled.Label: Totaled
EH.Condition.Unconcious.Label: Unconcious
EH.Configuration.Title: {type} Configuration
EH.Consumption.Label: Consumption
EH.Consumption.Amount.Label: Amount
EH.Consumption.Amount.Hint: Quantity of resource consumed. Negative numbers will cause the targeted resource to be recovered.
EH.Consumption.Dice.Label: Dice Count
EH.Consumption.Dice.Hint: When a resource is consumed that has an associated die, how many dice should be rolled. This number is independant of the number of that resource consumed.
EH.Consumption.Dice.Bonus.Hint: Bonus formula added to a resource roll made.
EH.Consumption.ResourceRolls.Label: Resource Rolls
EH.Consumption.Target.Label: Target
EH.Consumption.Target.Hint: ID or identifier of the target resource being consumed. Format depends on what type of selected.
EH.Consumption.Type.Label: Type
EH.Consumption.Type.Hint: Type of resources is consumed when this item is activated (e.g. actor resource, hit dice, another item’s uses).
EH.Creature.Type.Label: Creature Type
EH.Creature.Type.Tags.Label: Type Tags
EH.Creature.Type.Alien.Label: Alien
EH.Creature.Type.Animal.Label: Animal
EH.Creature.Type.Autonomous.Label: Autonomous
EH.Creature.Type.Demon.Label: Demon
EH.Creature.Type.Futuristic.Label: Futuristic
EH.Creature.Type.Human.Label: Human
EH.Creature.Type.Monster.Label: Monster
EH.Creature.Type.Mutant.Label: Mutant
EH.Creature.Type.Person.Label: Person
EH.Creature.Type.Prehistoric.Label: Prehistoric
EH.Creature.Type.RemoteControlled.Label: Remote-Controlled
EH.Creature.Type.Robot.Label: Robot
EH.Creature.Type.Shifter.Label: Shifter
EH.Creature.Type.Swarm.Label: Swarm
EH.Creature.Type.Undead.Label: Undead
EH.Damage.IgnoresArmor.Label: Ignores Armor
EH.Damage.Immunity.Label: Damage Immunity
EH.Damage.Immunity.Hint: An actor cannot be damaged by these damage types.
EH.Damage.Reduction.Label: Damage Reduction
EH.Damage.Reduction.Hint: Any incoming damage of this type will be reduced by the specified amount.
EH.Death.Bonus.Label: Death Save Bonus
EH.Death.Bonus.Hint: Bonus formula added to each death saving throw roll.
EH.Death.Success.Label: Success
EH.Death.Success.Hint: Number of successful death saving throws.
EH.Death.Failure.Label: Failure
EH.Death.Failure.Hint: Number of failed death saving throws.
EH.Death.Message.CriticalSuccess: {name} critically succeeded on a death saving throw and has regained 1 Hit Point!
EH.Death.Message.Success: {name} has succeeded on {counted} and is now stable.
EH.Death.Override.Failure.Label: Failures Required
EH.Death.Override.Failure.Hint: Number of failures required before the actor dies.
EH.Death.Override.Success.Label: Successes Required
EH.Death.Override.Success.Hint: Number of successes required before the actor stabilizes.
EH.Death.Override.Target.Label: Target Value
EH.Death.Override.Target.Hint: Value that must be rolled to be considered a success.
EH.Death.Status.Label: Status
EH.Defense.Label: Defense
EH.Defense.Bonus.Label: Defense Bonus
EH.Defense.Bonus.Hint: Bonus formula added to the calculated defense value.
EH.Details.Label: Details
EH.Details.Wealth.Label: Wealth
EH.Details.Wealth.Profession.Hint: Baseline wealth level provided by this profession.
EH.Details.Wealth.Bonus.Label: Wealth Bonus
EH.Details.Wealth.Bonus.Hint: Bonus added to the base wealth level provided by the hero's profession.
EH.DifficultyClass.Label: Difficulty Class
EH.Equipment.Category.Advanced.Label: Advanced
EH.Equipment.Category.Basic.Label: Basic
EH.Equipment.Category.Historical.Label: Historical
EH.Equipment.Category.Improvised.Label: Improvised
EH.Equipment.Category.Military.Label: Military
EH.Equipment.Proficiency.Hint: Equipment proficiencies possessed by the hero.
EH.Equipment.Trait.ArmorValue.Label: Armor Value
EH.Equipment.Trait.ArmorValue.Hint: Armor Value measures how well armor or a shield protects you against weapons.
EH.Equipment.Trait.Bulk.Label: Bulk
EH.Equipment.Trait.Bulk.Hint: Bulk provides an indicator for how heavy and/or unwieldy the item is.
EH.Equipment.Trait.Damage.Label: Damage
EH.Equipment.Trait.Damage.Hint: This is how much damage the weapon does before bonuses are applied, as well as what type of damage it deals.
EH.Equipment.Trait.Damage.Count.Label: Dice Count
EH.Equipment.Trait.Damage.Type.Label: Damage Type
EH.Equipment.Trait.Damage.Types.Label: Damage Types
EH.Equipment.Trait.Damage.Types.Hint: The attacker may choose whichever listed damage type is more favorable to the moment.
EH.Equipment.Trait.DamageModification.Label: Damage Modification
EH.Equipment.Trait.DamageModification.Hint: This is how much the damage of the base weapon is modified by this ammunition.
EH.Equipment.Trait.DamageModification.Count: Change to the number of dice rolled. If a negative count reduces the number of dice to zero, then only 1 damage will be done.
EH.Equipment.Trait.DamageModification.Denom: Number of dice steps to shift the denomination. If denomination is stepped below a d4, then only 1 damage will be done.
Weapon damage will be changed to this.
EH.Equipment.Trait.PenetrationValue.Label: Penetration Value
EH.Equipment.Trait.PenetrationValue.Hint: This measures a weapon’s ability to punch through armor and shields.
EH.Equipment.Trait.PriceLevel.Label: Price Level
EH.Equipment.Trait.PriceLevel.Hint: Price level is a general measure of how expensive something is. If the price level is equal or lower than your Wealth Level, then you can buy the item freely.
EH.Equipment.Trait.Quantity.Label: Quantity
EH.Equipment.Trait.Quantity.Hint: How many of this item are in a stack.
EH.Equipment.Trait.Radius.Label: Radius
EH.Equipment.Trait.Radius.Hint: This value lists the blast radius for explosives. Each combatant in that radius is subject to the effects of the explosion.
EH.Equipment.Trait.Range.Label: Range
EH.Equipment.Trait.Range.Hint: This is the distance at which you can target a ranged weapon. If two numbers are listed, the second number is its long range. Attacks made at a distance farther than its range but within its long range have disadvantage on the attack roll.
EH.Equipment.Trait.Range.Long.Label: Long Range
EH.Equipment.Trait.Range.Long.Hint: Weapon can fire within this extended range, but attacks will be at disadvantage.
EH.Equipment.Trait.Range.Reach.Label: Reach
EH.Equipment.Trait.Range.Reach.Hint: Reach of a weapon that has the ‘reach’ property.
EH.Equipment.Trait.Range.Short.Label: Normal Range
EH.Equipment.Trait.Range.Short.Hint: Range within which the weapon can fire without any penalty.
EH.Equipment.Trait.Reload.Label: Reload
EH.Equipment.Trait.Reload.Hint: Reload tells you what type of action you need to reload a weapon: an action, bonus action, or free action.
EH.Equipment.Trait.Reload.Actions.Label: Reload Actions
EH.Equipment.Trait.Reload.Actions.Hint: Number of subsequent actions required to reload this weapon.
EH.Equipment.Trait.Rounds.Label: Rounds
EH.Equipment.Trait.Rounds.Hint: This value shows how many rounds of ammunition you can fire before you must reload. Each time you fire the weapon, you use a number of rounds. Normally each attack uses a single round, but certain special attacks use more.
EH.Equipment.Trait.Rounds.Burst.Label: Burst Rounds
EH.Equipment.Trait.Rounds.Burst.Hint: Indicates the number of ammo rounds required when firing in burst mode.
EH.Equipment.Trait.SupplementalDamage.Label: Supplemental Damage
EH.Equipment.Trait.SupplementalDamage.Hint: Additional damage parts applied on top of the base item damage.
EH.Equipment.Trait.SupplementalDamage.Custo: Should this supplemental damage's custom PV be used rather than the weapon's default PV?
EH.Explosive.DC.Label: Explosive Damage Save DC
EH.Explosive.DC.Hint: Override the default save DC calculated base on the attacker's stats.
EH.Explosive.Properties.Label: Explosive Properties
EH.Explosive.Type.Label: Explosive Type
EH.Explosive.Type.Grenade.Label: Grenade
EH.Explosive.Type.Rocket.Label: Rocket
EH.Explosive.Type.Mine.Label: Mine
EH.Explosive.Type.Mortar.Label: Mortar
EH.Feat.Category.Label: Feat Category
EH.Feat.Category.Advanced.Label: Advanced
EH.Feat.Category.Basic.Label: Basic
EH.Feat.Category.Multiclass.Label: Multiclass
EH.Feat.Type.Major.Label: Major
EH.Feat.Type.Minor.Label: Minor
EH.Gear.Type.EverydayStuff.Label: Everyday Stuff
EH.Gear.Type.EquipmentPack.Label: Equipment Pack
EH.Gear.Type.SpecializedKit.Label: Specialized Kit
EH.Gear.Type.FirearmAccessory.Label: Firearm Accessory
EH.Gear.Type.CarryingCase.Label: Carrying Case
EH.Gear.Type.Electronics.Label: Electronics
EH.Gear.Type.Hardware.Label: Hardware
EH.Gear.Type.SpecialtyGoods.Label: Specialty Goods
EH.Gear.Type.SportingGoods.Label: Sporting Goods
EH.Feature.Limit.Label: Feature Limits
EH.Feature.Limit.Hint: Limits to the number of a certain feature type (such as plans or tricks) that the hero is allowed to have.
EH.Health.Label: Health
EH.HitDice.Minimum.Label: Minimum Hit Dice Roll
EH.HitDice.Minimum.Hint: Minimum result of a hit dice roll.
EH.HitDice.Recovery.Label: Hit Dice Recovery Percentage
EH.HitDice.Recovery.Hint: Percent of hit dice recovered during a long rest.
EH.HitPoints.Formula.Label: Formula
EH.HitPoints.Formula.Hint: Formula used for rolling hit points, if DM chooses not to use average value.
EH.HitPoints.Multiplier.Label: Max HP Multiplier
EH.HitPoints.Multiplier.Hint: Max hit points will be multiplied by this value and fractional results will be rounded down.
EH.HitPoints.Bonus.Level.Label: Per Level Bonus
EH.HitPoints.Bonus.Level.Hint: Bonus formula added to calculated hit points for each hero level.
EH.HitPoints.Bonus.Overall.Label: Overall Bonus
EH.HitPoints.Bonus.Overall.Hint: Bonus formula added to final calculated hit points once.
EH.Identifier.Label: Identifier
EH.Identifier.Hint: Simplified version of name used for internal lookups.
EH.Identifier.ClassArchetype.Hint: Identifier of the archetype to which this class belongs.
EH.Identifier.PlanClass.Hint: Identifier of the class to which this plan belongs.
EH.Identifier.TrickClass.Hint: Identifier of the class to which this trick belongs.
EH.Identifier.Error.Invalid: Identifier can only contain letters (a-z), numbers (0-9), dashes (-), and underscores (_).
EH.Initiative.Label: Initiative
EH.Initiative.Bonus.Label: Initiative Bonus
EH.Initiative.Bonus.Hint: Bonus formula added to all initiative rolls.
EH.Initiative.Turns.Label: Turns per Round
EH.Initiative.Turns.Hint: Number of turns this actor gets in a round, with a seperate initiative roll for each.

Inline.NoActorWarning: No selected or assigned actor could be found to execute this roll.

Mode.Label: Mode
Mode.Hint: Current firing mode for a weapon, such as one-handed, offhand, or suppressive fire.

Context.Label: Item Context
Context.Hint: Additional information on items held by this actor, such as whether the item is equipped or what ammunition is loaded.

Chat.Label: Chat Text
Chat.Hint: Alternative description displayed in chat when this item is activated.

Source.Label: Source
Source.Hint: Source book where this can be found.

EH.Keybinding.ChallengeRoll.Advantage.Label: Fast Forward Challenge Roll with Advantage
EH.Keybinding.ChallengeRoll.Disadvantage.La: Fast Forward Challenge Roll with Disadvantage
EH.Keybinding.ChallengeRoll.Normal.Label: Fast Forward Challenge Roll
EH.Keybinding.DamageRoll.Critical.Label: Fast Forward Damage Roll as Critical
EH.Keybinding.DamageRoll.Normal.Label: Fast Forward Damage Roll
EH.Level.Talent.Hint: Level at which this talent is granted.
EH.Luck.Label: Luck Saving Throw
EH.Measurement.Radius.Label: Radius
EH.Measurement.Length.Feet.Label: Feet
EH.Measurement.Length.Kilometers.Label: Kilometers
EH.Measurement.Length.Meters.Label: Meters
EH.Measurement.Length.Miles.Label: Miles
EH.Measurement.Speed.Mach.Label: Mach
EH.Measurement.Speed.MilePerHour.Label: Miles per Hour
EH.Measurement.Speed.KilometerPerHour.Label: Kilometers per Hour
EH.Movement.Base.Label: Base Movement
EH.Movement.Bonus.Label: Speed Bonus
EH.Movement.Multiplier.Label: Speed Multiplier
EH.Movement.Multiplier.Hint: All movement types will be multiplied by this value and fractional results will be rounded down.
EH.Movement.Special.Label: Special Movement
EH.Movement.Special.Hint: Other types of movement possessed by this actor.
EH.Movement.Tags.Label: Movement Tags
EH.Movement.Tags.Hint: Tags that describe any special movement abilities for the actor.
EH.Movement.Tag.Hover.Label: Hover
EH.Movement.Type.Burrow.Label: Burrow
EH.Movement.Type.Climb.Label: Climb
EH.Movement.Type.Fly.Label: Fly
EH.Movement.Type.Swim.Label: Swim
EH.Movement.Type.Walk.Label: Walk
EH.Override.Label: Overrides
EH.Override.Ability.Label: Alternative Abilities
EH.Override.Ability.Hint: Alternative abilities will be considered against the default ability for this calculation and the one with the highest modifier will be chosen.
EH.Override.Ability.Defense.Label: Alternative Defense Abilities
EH.Override.Ability.Defense.Hint: Alternate abilities that can be used to calculate defense bonus in addition to those provided by your archetype. The ability with the highest modifier will be automatically chosen.
EH.Override.Ability.HitPoints.Label: Alternative Hit Points Abilities
EH.Override.Ability.HitPoints.Hint: Alternate abilities that can be used to calculate total hit points in addition to constitution. The ability with the highest modifier will be automatically chosen.
EH.Override.Ability.Initiative.Label: Alternative Initiative Abilities
EH.Override.Ability.Initiative.Hint: Alternate abilities that can be used when rolling for initiative in addition to dexterity. The ability with the highest modifier will be automatically chosen.
EH.Override.Ability.Melee.Label: Alternative Melee Abilities
EH.Override.Ability.Melee.Hint: Alternate abilities that can be used when making melee attacks in addition to strength. The ability with the highest modifier will be automatically chosen.
EH.Override.Ability.Ranged.Label: Alternative Ranged Abilities
EH.Override.Ability.Ranged.Hint: Alternate abilities that can be used when making ranged attacks in addition to dexterity. The ability with the highest modifier will be automatically chosen.
EH.Proficiency.Bonus.Label: Proficiency Bonus
EH.Recharge.Label: Recharge
EH.Recharge.Target.Label: Target
EH.Recharge.Target.Hint: After this feature has been used, a NPC must roll the provided number or higher on a d6 in order to regain use if it.
EH.Recharge.Warning.NotCharged: Feature cannot be activated because it is not charged.
EH.Rest.Action.Rest.Label: Rest
EH.Rest.MedicalAttention.Label: Medical Attention
EH.Rest.MedicalAttention.Hint: A hero can provide medical attention to another during a short rest to give the receiving hero advantage on hit dice rolls. Any heroes providing medical attention cannot regain hit points of their own during that rest.
EH.Rest.Result.Long.Full: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {hitPoints} {hitPointsLabel} and {hitDice} {hitDiceLabel}.
EH.Rest.Result.Long.HitDice: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {hitDice} {hitDiceLabel}.
EH.Rest.Result.Long.HitPoints: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {hitPoints} {hitPointsLabel}.
EH.Rest.Result.Short.Full: {name} takes a short rest and spends {hitDice} {hitDiceLabel} to recover {hitPoints} {hitPointsLabel}.
EH.Rest.Type.Long.Label: Long Rest
EH.Rest.Type.Long.Hint: At the end of a long rest, each participant recovers hit points up to their hit point maximum and regains a number of spent Hit Dice up to half their maximum Hit Dice (rounded up).
EH.Rest.Type.Short.Label: Short Rest
EH.Rest.Type.Short.Hint: At the end of a short rest, a character can spend one or more Hit Dice, up to their maximum number of Hit Dice, to recover lost hit points.

Bonus.Label: Resource Cap Bonus
Bonus.Hint: Bonus formula applied to the cap of this resource.

Max.Label: Max Available
Max.Hint: Maximum of this resource available at any given time.

Minimum.Label: Minimum Roll
Minimum.Hint: Minimum roll result for this resource.

Config.Uses.Label: Resource Uses
Config.Label.Label: Resource Label
Config.Custom.Label: Custom Resource
Config.Warning.NoLabel: Resources must be provided a label.

EH.Role.Fodder.Label: Fodder
EH.Role.Hulk.Label: Hulk
EH.Role.Killer.Label: Killer
EH.Role.Leader.Label: Leader
EH.Role.Loner.Label: Loner
EH.Role.Melee.Label: Melee
EH.Role.Ranged.Label: Ranged
EH.Role.Shadow.Label: Shadow
EH.Role.Support.Label: Support
EH.Role.Tank.Label: Tank
EH.Sense.Hint: Special senses possessed by the actor.
EH.Sense.Nightvision.Label: Nightvision

ChallengeVisibility.Name: Challenge Visibility
ChallengeVisibility.Hint: Control what roll DCs are visible to the players and whether successess/failures are highlighted.

InitiativeTiebreaker.Label: Initiative Tiebreaker
InitiativeTiebreaker.Hint: Add initiative ability score as decimal to help break ties in initiatives.

ReduceTransparency.Label: Reduce Transparency
ReduceTransparency.Hint: Remove the transparency from behind sheets to reduce visual distraction.

TitanicSizes.Label: Titanic Sizes
TitanicSizes.Hint: Allow the use of titanic sizes on NPCs.

EH.Size.Label: Size
EH.Size.Normal.Label: Normal
EH.Size.Scale.Normal.Label: Normal Scale
EH.Size.Scale.Titanic.Label: Titanic Scale
EH.Size.Huge.Label: Huge
EH.Size.Gargantuan.Label: Gargantuan

EH.Skill.Abilities.Label: Ability Choices
EH.Skill.Abilities.Hint: Abilities that can be used when rolling this skill in addition to the default. The system will automatically select the ability with the highest modifier to use.
EH.Skill.Bonus.Check.Label: Skill Check Bonus
EH.Skill.Bonus.Check.GlobalHint: Bonus formula added to all skill checks.
EH.Skill.Bonus.Check.SpecificHint: Bonus formula added to checks using this skill.
EH.Skill.Bonus.Passive.Label: Passive Skill Bonus
EH.Skill.Bonus.Passive.GlobalHint: Bonus formula added to the calculated passive score for all skills.
EH.Skill.Bonus.Passive.SpecificHint: Bonus formula added to the calculated passive score for this skill.
EH.Skill.Configuration.Hint: The bonus applies to skill check formulas and the minimum prevents the d20 roll from dropping below a certain number.
EH.Skill.Configuration.Global.Label: Global Skill Configuration
EH.Skill.Configuration.Global.Hint: The following options apply to all skills.
EH.Skill.Configuration.Specific.Label: {type} Configuration
EH.Skill.Override.Minimum.Label: Skill Check Minimum
EH.Skill.Override.Minimum.GlobalHint: When rolling any skill check, the result will never be lower than this value.
EH.Skill.Override.Minimum.SpecificHint: When rolling a check with this skill, the result will never be lower than this value.
EH.Skill.Override.Minimum.Proficiency.Label: Skill Check Proficiency Floor
EH.Skill.Override.Minimum.Proficiency.Hint: Minimum proficiency multiplier for all skill checks.
EH.Target.Conditions.Label: Required Conditions
EH.Target.Conditions.Hint: Creatures must have one of these conditions to be targeted.
EH.Target.Count.Label: Target Count
EH.Target.Count.Hint: Number of targets that can be affected.
EH.Target.Custom.Label: Custom Text
EH.Target.Custom.Hint: Custom text that will be used in place of auto-generated target description.
EH.Traits.Label: Traits
EH.Uses.Label: Limited Uses
EH.Uses.AvailableGeneric.Label: {available}/{max} uses
EH.Uses.AvailableSpecific.Label: {available}/{max} per {period}
EH.Uses.Max.Label: Max Uses
EH.Uses.Max.Hint: Formula indicating how many times this item can be used during a period.
EH.Uses.Spent.Label: Spent Uses
EH.Uses.Recovery.Formula.Label: Amount Recovered
EH.Uses.Recovery.Mode.Label: Recovery Mode
EH.Uses.Recovery.Mode.Recover.Label: Regain Uses
EH.Uses.Recovery.Mode.Recover.Hint: Uses will be reset back to maximum during the recovery period.
EH.Uses.Recovery.Mode.Reset.Label: Reset Uses
EH.Uses.Recovery.Mode.Reset.Hint: Any uses will be reset to zero during the recovery period.
EH.Uses.Recovery.Period.Label: Recovery Period
EH.Uses.Recovery.Period.Hint: Time over which this item's uses will be restored.
EH.Uses.Recovery.Period.Encounter.Label: Encounter
EH.Uses.Recovery.Period.Round.Label: Round
EH.Uses.Recovery.Period.Turn.Label: Turn
EH.Uses.Warning.Insufficient: No uses of this item remaining.
EH.Vehicle.Bonus.Hint: Bonuses applied to the vehicle from this driver.
EH.Vehicle.Category.Label: Category
EH.Vehicle.Modifications.Label: Modifications
EH.Vehicle.People.Hint: People currently in this vehicle with additional context information.
EH.Vehicle.Type.Label: Vehicle Type
EH.Vehicle.Category.Civilian.Label: Civilian
EH.Vehicle.Category.Commercial.Label: Commercial
EH.Vehicle.Category.LawEnforcement.Label: Law Enforcement
EH.Vehicle.Category.Military.Label: Military
EH.Vehicle.Error.OnlyPeople: Only people can be added to vehicles.
EH.Vehicle.Error.NoPacks: Actors within compendiums cannot be added to a vehicle.
EH.Vehicle.Prompt.Message: This person is already in another vehicle, {other}. Would you like to move them over to {this}.
EH.Vehicle.Prompt.Title: Confirm Vehicle Switch
EH.Vehicle.Property.Label: Vehicle Properties
EH.Vehicle.Property.AccidentProne.Label: Accident Prone
EH.Vehicle.Property.AccidentProne.Hint: Checks made to avoid crashing with this vehicle have disadvantage. It crashes automatically if it has no driver.
EH.Vehicle.Property.Airspeed.Label: Airspeed
EH.Vehicle.Property.Airspeed.Hint: This vehicle travels at high speeds, easily outpacing any land vehicle.
EH.Vehicle.Property.AllTerrain.Label: All-Terrain
EH.Vehicle.Property.AllTerrain.Hint: This vehicle does not suffer disadvantage when driving off-road or in other harsh conditions.
EH.Vehicle.Property.Bulletproof.Label: Bulletproof
EH.Vehicle.Property.Bulletproof.Hint: The vehicle’s tires and windows are bulletproof and have an AV of 2.
EH.Vehicle.Property.Enclosed.Label: Enclosed
EH.Vehicle.Property.Enclosed.Hint: The vehicle is encased in armor. Passengers always have total cover if they are inside the vehicle.
EH.Vehicle.Property.Exposed.Label: Exposed
EH.Vehicle.Property.Exposed.Hint: This vehicle leaves its driver and passengers exposed to the elements.
EH.Vehicle.Property.ExtraWheels.Label: Extra Wheels
EH.Vehicle.Property.ExtraWheels.Hint: This vehicle has more wheels than usual. It does not suffer the Blown Tires condition until three or more tires have been destroyed.
EH.Vehicle.Property.Gliding.Label: Gliding
EH.Vehicle.Property.Gliding.Hint: This vehicle cannot fly under its own power and cannot gain altitude without the help of the wind.
EH.Vehicle.Property.MusclePowered.Label: Muscle-Powered
EH.Vehicle.Property.MusclePowered.Hint: This vehicle is powered by pedals or a similar mechanism. Add the driver’s Strength modifier to the vehicle’s. The driver uses Strength (Athletics) in place of Dexterity (Vehicles) when making checks to operate this vehicle.
EH.Vehicle.Property.Railed.Label: Railed
EH.Vehicle.Property.Railed.Hint: Railed vehicles such as trains travel using steel wheels on steel rails. They cannot suffer the Blown Tires condition.
EH.Vehicle.Property.Stable.Label: Stable
EH.Vehicle.Property.Stable.Hint: Attacks made while this vehicle is in motion do not suffer disadvantage due to that movement.
EH.Vehicle.Property.Special.Label: Special
EH.Vehicle.Property.Special.Hint: This vehicle has additional detailed rules listed in its description.
EH.Vehicle.Property.Tracked.Label: Tracked
EH.Vehicle.Property.Tracked.Hint: Tracked vehicles drive on large metal belts sitting on metal wheels. They cannot suffer the Blown Tires condition.
EH.Vehicle.Roll.CrashCheck.Label: Crash Check
EH.Vehicle.Roll.DamageSave.Label: Damage Save
EH.Vehicle.Roll.PassengerDamage.Label: Passenger Damage
EH.Vehicle.Roll.SpeedContest.Label: Speed Contest
EH.Vehicle.Roll.StuntCheck.Label: Stunt Check
EH.Vehicle.Roll.VehicleDamage.Label: Vehicle Damage
EH.Vehicle.Size.Label: Vehicle Size
EH.Vehicle.Trait.ArmorValue.Hint: Like any object, a vehicle’s Armor Value determines what weapons can damage it. A vehicle’s windows and tires have their own AV of 1 by default.
EH.Vehicle.Trait.ArmorValue.Body.Label: Body AV
EH.Vehicle.Trait.Passengers.Label: Passengers
EH.Vehicle.Trait.Passengers.Hint: The number of people who can comfortably fit in the vehicle, including the driver.
EH.Vehicle.Trait.SpeedCategory.Label: Speed Category
EH.Vehicle.Trait.SpeedCategory.Hint: Rough speed at which the vehicle is moving. Determines defense, certain DCs, and crash damage.
EH.Vehicle.Trait.SpeedCategory.Low.Label: Low
EH.Vehicle.Trait.SpeedCategory.Mid.Label: Mid
EH.Vehicle.Trait.SpeedCategory.High.Label: High
EH.Vehicle.Trait.TopSpeed.Label: Top Speed
EH.Vehicle.Trait.TopSpeed.Hint: A vehicle’s top speed is included for comparison purposes but is not used in the game mechanics for chases or combat.
EH.Vehicle.Type.Air.Label: Aircraft
EH.Vehicle.Type.Land.Label: Land Vehicle
EH.Vehicle.Type.Space.Label: Spacecraft
EH.Vehicle.Type.Water.Label: Boat
EH.VehicleModification.Ability.Label: Ability Modifications
EH.VehicleModification.Ability.Hint: Changes to a vehicle's ability modifiers from this modification.
EH.VehicleModification.ArmorValue.Label: Armor Value Upgrade
EH.VehicleModification.ArmorValue.Hint: The vehicle's body AV will be increased to this value.
EH.Weapon.Jammed.Label: Jammed
EH.Weapon.Action.Attack.Warning.Empty: Weapon does not have enough rounds to fire.
EH.Weapon.Action.Attack.Warning.Jammed: Weapon cannot be fired while it is jammed.
EH.Weapon.Action.Burst.Label: Burst
EH.Weapon.Action.DamageGeneric.Label: Damage
EH.Weapon.Action.DamageSourced.Label: {source} Damage
EH.Weapon.Action.DamageSpecific.Label: {type} Damage
EH.Weapon.Action.Melee.Label: Melee
EH.Weapon.Action.Offhand.Label: Off-hand
EH.Weapon.Action.Ranged.Label: Ranged
EH.Weapon.Action.Reload.Label: Reload
EH.Weapon.Action.Reload.Warning.Jammed: Weapon cannot be reloaded while it is jammed.
EH.Weapon.Action.SuppressiveFire.Label: Suppressive Fire
EH.Weapon.Action.SuppressiveFire.Message: {actor} fills the battlefield with bullets from a {weapon}.
EH.Weapon.Action.Thrown.Label: Thrown
EH.Weapon.Action.ThrownExplosive.Label: Thrown Explosive
EH.Weapon.Action.ClearJam.Label: Clear Jam
EH.Weapon.Bonus.Attack.Label: Attack Bonus
EH.Weapon.Bonus.Attack.Hint: Formula added to the default attack roll.
EH.Weapon.Bonus.Critical.Label: Criticals
EH.Weapon.Bonus.Critical.Hint: Extra dice added to base damage die and extra damage formula when critical damage is rolled. Both of these values are added after critical multiplication is performed.
EH.Weapon.Bonus.Critical.Damage.Label: Critical Formula
EH.Weapon.Bonus.Critical.Damage.Hint: Extra damage formula add when critical damage is rolled. This is added after normal critical multiplication is performed.
EH.Weapon.Bonus.Critical.Dice.Label: Critical Dice
EH.Weapon.Bonus.Critical.Dice.Hint: Number of additional dice of the base weapon damage dice added during a critical hit. This is added after normal critical multiplication is performed.
EH.Weapon.Bonus.Damage.Label: Damage Bonus
EH.Weapon.Bonus.DC.Label: DC Bonus
EH.Weapon.Bonus.DC.Hint: Formula for a change to the auto-calculated DC.
EH.Weapon.Mode.Burst.Label: Burst
EH.Weapon.Mode.Offhand.Label: Off-hand
EH.Weapon.Mode.OneHanded.Label: One-handed
EH.Weapon.Mode.SuppressiveFire.Label: Suppressive Fire
EH.Weapon.Mode.Thrown.Label: Thrown
EH.Weapon.Mode.TwoHanded.Label: Two-handed
EH.Weapon.Mode.Swarm.Label: Swarm
EH.Weapon.Mode.Swarm.NPCHint: if the swarm is at half its hit points or fewer
EH.Weapon.Overrides.Ability.Attack.Label: Attack Ability
EH.Weapon.Overrides.Ability.Attack.Hint: Force this weapon to use an alternate ability for attack rolls.
EH.Weapon.Overrides.Ability.Damage.Label: Damage Ability
EH.Weapon.Overrides.Ability.Damage.Hint: Force this weapon to use an alternate ability for damage rolls.
EH.Weapon.Overrides.Critical.Threshold.Glob: Override the critical hit threshold for all weapons of the specified types. Currently supported keys are 'all', 'melee', and 'ranged'.
EH.Weapon.Overrides.Critical.Threshold.Spec: Override the critical hit threshold for this weapon. This is the number that must be rolled for this weapon to score a critical hit (so 18 will result in a critical if 18, 19, or 20 are rolled on the die).
EH.Weapon.Property.Label: Weapon Properties
EH.Weapon.Property.Aquatic.Label: Aquatic
EH.Weapon.Property.Aquatic.Hint: Aquatic ranged weapons can be used underwater without penalty.
EH.Weapon.Property.Aquatic.NPCHint: This attack can be used underwater normally.
EH.Weapon.Property.Belt.Label: Belt
EH.Weapon.Property.Belt.Hint: Belt-fed weapons have a chain of ammunition on a belt. The size of the belt can vary, but 100-round belts are a common length. You should note the size of the belt you are using.
EH.Weapon.Property.Blinding.Label: Blinding
EH.Weapon.Property.Blinding.Hint: Blinding weapons use chemical agents or intense light to temporarily blind opponents. In addition to the listed damage, the target must make a Constitution saving throw or be Blinded for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save. Chemical blinding agents are ineffective against anyone wearing a full face covering or eye protection. Blinding weapons do not add an ability score bonus to their damage rolls.
EH.Weapon.Property.Burst.Label: Burst
EH.Weapon.Property.Burst.Hint: Weapons with the burst fire property can expend additional ammunition to deal increased damage. The number indicates the number of ammo rounds required. Using burst fire imposes disadvantage on the attack roll but adds one damage die if the attack succeeds. Combatants must declare they are using burst fire before they roll their attack. Burst fire cannot be used at long range.
EH.Weapon.Property.Deafening.Label: Deafening
EH.Weapon.Property.Deafening.Hint: Deafening weapons use intense noise to temporarily deafen opponents. In addition to any damage, the target must make a Constitution saving throw or gain the Deafened condition and suffer disadvantage on Dexterity ability checks due to temporary inner ear damage, both for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save.
EH.Weapon.Property.Disguised.Label: Disguised
EH.Weapon.Property.Disguised.Hint: This weapon is designed to look like a mundane item until it is readied for use. It can be identified only by a hands-on inspection.
EH.Weapon.Property.Finesse.Label: Finesse
EH.Weapon.Property.Finesse.Hint: When you use this weapon to make a melee attack, you can choose to use your Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls instead of Strength.
EH.Weapon.Property.FullAuto.Label: Full-Auto
EH.Weapon.Property.FullAuto.Hint: A full-auto mechanism cocks the gun and loads a new round from the magazine each time a round is fired. The gun fires continuously as long as the trigger is held down. This allows you to use the Suppressive Fire action.
EH.Weapon.Property.Grenade.Label: Grenade
EH.Weapon.Property.Grenade.Hint: Grenades are explosives designed to be charged and then quickly thrown or launched. They require one hand to throw, and a free hand to arm them.
EH.Weapon.Property.Heavy.Label: Heavy
EH.Weapon.Property.Heavy.Hint: Heavy weapons are especially large and difficult to wield. Anyone with less than 15 Strength has disadvantage on attack rolls while wielding a heavy weapon. Heavy firearms can be fired without this penalty if they are fired from a stationary position, braced on the ground or a sturdy platform.
EH.Weapon.Property.Illuminating.Label: Illuminating
EH.Weapon.Property.Illuminating.Hint: This explosive creates a field of bright light within its radius. It is not blinding. It provides illumination for up to 30 minutes.
EH.Weapon.Property.Improvised.Label: Improvised
EH.Weapon.Property.Improvised.Hint: These objects are not well suited to be used as weapons. Wielders suffer disadvantage on attack rolls with these weapons unless they have the Improvised Equipment proficiency.
EH.Weapon.Property.Indirect.Label: Indirect
EH.Weapon.Property.Indirect.Hint: Indirect weapons are almost always some kind of thrown explosive.
EH.Weapon.Property.Light.Label: Light
EH.Weapon.Property.Light.Hint: Light weapons are small enough to effectively wield one in each hand.
EH.Weapon.Property.Loud.Label: Loud
EH.Weapon.Property.Loud.Hint: Loud weapons can be heard up to 2 miles away and are easily detected through building walls.
EH.Weapon.Property.Reach.Label: Reach
EH.Weapon.Property.Reach.Hint: This is the distance at which you can strike an opponent with a melee weapon. Unless otherwise noted, melee weapons have a reach of 5 feet.
EH.Weapon.Property.Restricted.Label: Restricted
EH.Weapon.Property.Restricted.Hint: This equipment is limited to police and military in most or all of the US, and in many other jurisdictions worldwide. Even where it isn’t properly illegal, when in the hands of anyone but known authority figures, it raises eyebrows and draws attention.
EH.Weapon.Property.Returning.Label: Returning
EH.Weapon.Property.Returning.Hint: A returning weapon is designed to return to the person throwing it if the attack misses its target. If the thrower rolls a critical miss, the weapon does not return.
EH.Weapon.Property.SemiAuto.Label: Semi-Auto
EH.Weapon.Property.SemiAuto.Hint: A semi-auto mechanism cocks the gun and loads a new round from the magazine each time a round is fired. Each pull of the trigger fires one bullet.
EH.Weapon.Property.Shot.Label: Shot
EH.Weapon.Property.Shot.Hint: Shotguns typically fire buckshot rounds that make it easier to hit targets at close range. This weapon has advantage on attack rolls at ranges up to 30 feet.
EH.Weapon.Property.Shot.NPCHint: This attack is made at advantage against targets within 30 feet.
EH.Weapon.Property.SlowFiring.Label: Slow-Firing
EH.Weapon.Property.SlowFiring.Hint: A slow-firing weapon takes significant time to prepare each shot. As a result, you cannot attack more than once during your turn with a slow-firing weapon, even if you have the Advanced Combat Training talent.
EH.Weapon.Property.Special.Label: Special
EH.Weapon.Property.Special.Hint: This weapon has additional detailed rules listed in its description.
EH.Weapon.Property.Stationary.Label: Stationary
EH.Weapon.Property.Stationary.Hint: Guns with this property are too large to effectively fire while held. They are fired on the ground, from a platform, or mounted to a vehicle.
EH.Weapon.Property.Stunning.Label: Stunning
EH.Weapon.Property.Stunning.Hint: Stunning weapons use electrical pulses to temporarily incapacitate opponents. In addition to any electrical damage, a Medium size or smaller target must make a Constitution saving throw or gain the Stunned condition until the end of their next turn. Stunning weapons do not add an ability score bonus to their damage rolls.
EH.Weapon.Property.Swarm.Label: Swarm
EH.Weapon.Property.Thrown.Label: Thrown
EH.Weapon.Property.Thrown.Hint: Melee weapons that have the thrown property can be used either for a melee attack or thrown at an opponent as a ranged attack. If thrown, they use the same ability modifier for attack and damage as for a melee attack. Once thrown, it must be recovered before it can be thrown again.
EH.Weapon.Property.TwoHanded.Label: Two-Handed
EH.Weapon.Property.TwoHanded.Hint: These weapons require two hands to attack with, but they can be carried in one hand.
EH.Weapon.Property.Unreliable.Label: Unreliable
EH.Weapon.Property.Unreliable.Hint: Firearms with the unreliable property jam on a critical miss. A jammed gun cannot fire until an action is used to clear the jam.
EH.Weapon.Property.Versatile.Label: Versatile
EH.Weapon.Property.Versatile.Hint: These melee weapons can be used in one hand or two. When used with two hands, their base damage is one dice step higher.
EH.Weapon.Type.Label: Weapon Type
EH.Weapon.Type.Melee.Label: Melee
EH.Weapon.Type.Ranged.Label: Ranged
